---
title: "A&S 500 Final Project"
author:
  - name: "Jacob Saindon" #splitting should work in new versions of Quarto
    url: "https://jacographer.com/"
    orcid: 0000-0002-3808-9704
    affiliations:
      - name: "University of Kentucky"
citation:
  url: "https://jacographer.com/"
knitr:
  opts_chunk: 
    message: false
    warning: false
    fig-height: 5
    fig-width: 3
    fig-align: center
    cap-location: margin
execute:
  freeze: auto  # re-render only when source changes
format:
  html:
    theme: 
      - flatly
      - custom.scss
    toc: true
    toc-depth: 3
    toc-location: left #'body' goes into the top of doc
    toc-title: "Sections"
    title-block-banner: true
    #title-block-style: plain
    backgroundcolor: "green"
    fontcolor: "purple"
    include-in-header: google-font.html #file included in final proj.
    mainfont: Atkinson Hyperlegible
  docx: default
  pdf: default
    #toc: true
pdf-engine: pdflatex #necessary for this R server.
---


## Loading Packages

Tidyverse


::: {.cell .caption-margin}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```
:::


## Data


::: {.cell .caption-margin}

```{.r .cell-code}
snap <- read_csv("data/snap_political_19-22.csv")

view(snap)
```
:::


For 2020, look at top interests targeted per state, per month. facet_wrap

Count of month, state, interest


::: {.cell .caption-margin}

```{.r .cell-code}
#data |>
#group by (month, state, interest) |>
#summarise (n == n()) |>
#filter (n==max(n)) |>
#select(-month)
#maxes |>
#leftjoin(data)
```
:::

::: {.cell .caption-margin}

```{.r .cell-code}
snap |>
  filter(
    CountryCode == "united states",
    !is.na(Interests)
  ) |>
  mutate(
    STATE_INC = str_split(`Regions (Included)`, ",")
    ) |>
  unnest() |>
    mutate(
    STATE_EXC = str_split(`Regions (Excluded)`, ",")
    ) |>
  unnest() |>
  mutate(
    TARGET = str_split(`Interests`, ",")
    ) |>
    unnest() -> snap2

view(snap2)
```
:::


Text analysis of targeting categories, by state.

Unnest both "Regions" and "Interest" fields to get tidy.

#dlxs are oracle datalogix audiences? https://businesshelp.snapchat.com/s/article/custom-audiences?language=en_US

targetsmart and i360: https://www.axios.com/2022/09/08/snap-voter-data-republican-democrats
